member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the InvokeEndpointAsync operation. After you deploy a model into production using Amazon SageMaker hosting services, your client applications use this API to get inferences from the model hosted at the specified endpoint in an asynchronous manner.
Inference requests sent to this API are enqueued for asynchronous processing. The processing of the inference request may or may not complete before the you receive a response from this API. The response from this API will not contain the result of the inference request but contain information about where you can locate it.
Amazon SageMaker strips all POST headers except those supported by the API. Amazon SageMaker might add additional headers. You should not rely on the behavior of headers outside those enumerated in the request syntax.
Calls to InvokeEndpointAsync are authenticated by using AWS Signature Version 4. For information, see Authenticating Requests (AWS Signature Version 4) in the Amazon S3 API Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.Accept
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Accept.
The desired MIME type of the inference in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the input data in the request body.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.CustomAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomAttributes.
Provides additional information about a request for an inference submitted to a model hosted at an Amazon SageMaker endpoint. The information is an opaque value that is forwarded verbatim. You could use this value, for example, to provide an ID that you can use to track a request or to provide other metadata that a service endpoint was programmed to process. The value must consist of no more than 1024 visible US-ASCII characters as specified in Section 3.3.6. Field Value Components of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1).
The code in your model is responsible for setting or updating any custom attributes in the response. If your code does not set this value in the response, an empty value is returned. For example, if a custom attribute represents the trace ID, your model can prepend the custom attribute with Trace ID: in your post-processing function.
This feature is currently supported in the AWS SDKs but not in the Amazon SageMaker Python SDK.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.EndpointName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointName.
The name of the endpoint that you specified when you created the endpoint using the
CreateEndpoint API.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.InferenceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InferenceId.
The identifier for the inference request. Amazon SageMaker will generate an identifier for you if none is specified.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.InputLocation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputLocation.
The Amazon S3 URI where the inference request payload is stored.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest.RequestTTLSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestTTLSeconds.
Maximum age in seconds a request can be in the queue before it is marked as expired.

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the InvokeEndpointAsync operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncResponse.InferenceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InferenceId.
Identifier for an inference request. This will be the same as the InferenceId specified in the input. Amazon SageMaker will generate an identifier for you if you do not specify one.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncResponse.OutputLocation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputLocation.
The Amazon S3 URI where the inference response payload is stored.

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the InvokeEndpoint operation. After you deploy a model into production using Amazon SageMaker hosting services, your client applications use this API to get inferences from the model hosted at the specified endpoint.
For an overview of Amazon SageMaker, see How It Works.
Amazon SageMaker strips all POST headers except those supported by the API. Amazon SageMaker might add additional headers. You should not rely on the behavior of headers outside those enumerated in the request syntax.
Calls to InvokeEndpoint are authenticated by using AWS Signature Version 4. For information, see Authenticating Requests (AWS Signature Version 4) in the Amazon S3 API Reference.
A customer's model containers must respond to requests within 60 seconds. The model itself can have a maximum processing time of 60 seconds before responding to invocations. If your model is going to take 50-60 seconds of processing time, the SDK socket timeout should be set to be 70 seconds.
Endpoints are scoped to an individual account, and are not public. The URL does not contain the account ID, but Amazon SageMaker determines the account ID from the authentication token that is supplied by the caller.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.Accept
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Accept.
The desired MIME type of the inference in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
Provides input data, in the format specified in the ContentType request header. Amazon SageMaker passes all of the data in the body to the model.
For information about the format of the request body, see Common Data Formats-Inference.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the input data in the request body.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.CustomAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomAttributes.
Provides additional information about a request for an inference submitted to a model hosted at an Amazon SageMaker endpoint. The information is an opaque value that is forwarded verbatim. You could use this value, for example, to provide an ID that you can use to track a request or to provide other metadata that a service endpoint was programmed to process. The value must consist of no more than 1024 visible US-ASCII characters as specified in Section 3.3.6. Field Value Components of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1).
The code in your model is responsible for setting or updating any custom attributes in the response. If your code does not set this value in the response, an empty value is returned. For example, if a custom attribute represents the trace ID, your model can prepend the custom attribute with Trace ID: in your post-processing function.
This feature is currently supported in the AWS SDKs but not in the Amazon SageMaker Python SDK.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.EndpointName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointName.
The name of the endpoint that you specified when you created the endpoint using the CreateEndpoint API.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.InferenceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InferenceId.
If you provide a value, it is added to the captured data when you enable data capture on the endpoint. For information about data capture, see Capture Data.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.TargetContainerHostname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetContainerHostname.
If the endpoint hosts multiple containers and is configured to use direct invocation, this parameter specifies the host name of the container to invoke.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.TargetModel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetModel.
The model to request for inference when invoking a multi-model endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest.TargetVariant
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetVariant.
Specify the production variant to send the inference request to when invoking an endpoint that is running two or more variants. Note that this parameter overrides the default behavior for the endpoint, which is to distribute the invocation traffic based on the variant weights.
For information about how to use variant targeting to perform a/b testing, see Test models in production

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the InvokeEndpoint operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointResponse.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
Includes the inference provided by the model.
For information about the format of the response body, see Common Data Formats-Inference.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointResponse.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the inference returned in the response body.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointResponse.CustomAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomAttributes.
Provides additional information in the response about the inference returned by a model hosted at an Amazon SageMaker endpoint. The information is an opaque value that is forwarded verbatim. You could use this value, for example, to return an ID received in the CustomAttributes header of a request or other metadata that a service endpoint was programmed to produce. The value must consist of no more than 1024 visible US-ASCII characters as specified in Section 3.3.6. Field Value Components of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1). If the customer wants the custom attribute returned, the model must set the custom attribute to be included on the way back.
The code in your model is responsible for setting or updating any custom attributes in the response. If your code does not set this value in the response, an empty value is returned. For example, if a custom attribute represents the trace ID, your model can prepend the custom attribute with Trace ID: in your post-processing function.
This feature is currently supported in the AWS SDKs but not in the Amazon SageMaker Python SDK.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointResponse.InvokedProductionVariant
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvokedProductionVariant.
Identifies the production variant that was invoked.

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing SageMakerRuntime
The Amazon SageMaker runtime API.

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient.#ctor(Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient.InvokeEndpoint(Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointRequest)
member.summary:
After you deploy a model into production using Amazon SageMaker hosting services, your client applications use this API to get inferences from the model hosted at the specified endpoint.
For an overview of Amazon SageMaker, see How It Works.
Amazon SageMaker strips all POST headers except those supported by the API. Amazon SageMaker might add additional headers. You should not rely on the behavior of headers outside those enumerated in the request syntax.
Calls to InvokeEndpoint are authenticated by using AWS Signature Version 4. For information, see Authenticating Requests (AWS Signature Version 4) in the Amazon S3 API Reference.
A customer's model containers must respond to requests within 60 seconds. The model itself can have a maximum processing time of 60 seconds before responding to invocations. If your model is going to take 50-60 seconds of processing time, the SDK socket timeout should be set to be 70 seconds.
Endpoints are scoped to an individual account, and are not public. The URL does not contain the account ID, but Amazon SageMaker determines the account ID from the authentication token that is supplied by the caller.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InvokeEndpoint service method.
member.returns: The response from the InvokeEndpoint service method, as returned by SageMakerRuntime.
member.exception: An internal failure occurred.
Model (owned by the customer in the container) returned 4xx or 5xx error code.
The service is unavailable. Try your call again.
Inspect your request and try again.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InvokeEndpoint Operation

member.summary:
After you deploy a model into production using Amazon SageMaker hosting services, your client applications use this API to get inferences from the model hosted at the specified endpoint.
For an overview of Amazon SageMaker, see How It Works.
Amazon SageMaker strips all POST headers except those supported by the API. Amazon SageMaker might add additional headers. You should not rely on the behavior of headers outside those enumerated in the request syntax.
Calls to InvokeEndpoint are authenticated by using AWS Signature Version 4. For information, see Authenticating Requests (AWS Signature Version 4) in the Amazon S3 API Reference.
A customer's model containers must respond to requests within 60 seconds. The model itself can have a maximum processing time of 60 seconds before responding to invocations. If your model is going to take 50-60 seconds of processing time, the SDK socket timeout should be set to be 70 seconds.
Endpoints are scoped to an individual account, and are not public. The URL does not contain the account ID, but Amazon SageMaker determines the account ID from the authentication token that is supplied by the caller.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InvokeEndpoint service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the InvokeEndpoint service method, as returned by SageMakerRuntime.
member.exception: An internal failure occurred.
Model (owned by the customer in the container) returned 4xx or 5xx error code.

Inspect your request and try again.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InvokeEndpoint Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient.InvokeEndpointAsync(Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest)
member.summary:
After you deploy a model into production using Amazon SageMaker hosting services, your client applications use this API to get inferences from the model hosted at the specified endpoint in an asynchronous manner.
Inference requests sent to this API are enqueued for asynchronous processing. The processing of the inference request may or may not complete before the you receive a response from this API. The response from this API will not contain the result of the inference request but contain information about where you can locate it.
Amazon SageMaker strips all POST headers except those supported by the API. Amazon SageMaker might add additional headers. You should not rely on the behavior of headers outside those enumerated in the request syntax.
Calls to InvokeEndpointAsync are authenticated by using AWS Signature Version 4. For information, see Authenticating Requests (AWS Signature Version 4) in the Amazon S3 API Reference.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InvokeEndpointAsync service method.
member.returns: The response from the InvokeEndpointAsync service method, as returned by SageMakerRuntime.
member.exception: An internal failure occurred.
The service is unavailable. Try your call again.
Inspect your request and try again.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InvokeEndpointAsync Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.AmazonSageMakerRuntimeClient.InvokeEndpointAsyncAsync(Amazon.SageMakerRuntime.Model.InvokeEndpointAsyncRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

The response from this API will not contain the result of the inference request but contain information about where you can locate it.
Amazon SageMaker strips all POST headers except those supported by the API. Amazon SageMaker might add additional headers. You should not rely on the behavior of headers outside those enumerated in the request syntax.
Calls to InvokeEndpointAsync are authenticated by using AWS Signature Version 4. For information, see Authenticating Requests (AWS Signature Version 4) in the Amazon S3 API Reference.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InvokeEndpointAsync service method.

The service is unavailable. Try your call again.
